title: 362 - Why You End Up Right Where You Started and 3 Ways to Breakthrough
description:
Listen and Subscribe on Apple, Spotify and more: https://link.chtbl.com/creativepeptalk

Transcripts available at https://creativepeptalk.com/episodes

__________

SHOW NOTES

Lauren Hom’s “Creative Productivity: Build a Brief to Boost Your Passion Project” Skillshare Class

__________

CALL TO ADVENTURE

The Woodchuck Activity:
- Take your body of work from the past and try to identify the categories.
- Filter them through the Venn diagram of Novel & Useful.
- Find what overlap can help you build a system that strikes a balance!

__________

SPONSORS

SHILLINGTON
Study graphic design with Shillington for 3 months full-time or 9 months part-time. With Shillington’s graphic design course, you’ll graduate with a solid understanding of creative problem solving, design theory and software. Create an incredible design portfolio and master how to discuss and sell your work—essential skills for any creative career. LEARN MORE: https://shillo.design/pep

SKILLSHARE
There’s nothing better than getting better. Accomplishing growth is extremely satisfying, and online classes from Skillshare make it possible. Learn about illustration, design, photography, productivity, and marketing. With Skillshare’s short classes, you can move your creative journey forward without putting life on hold. So explore your creativity at Skillshare.com/CreativePep where our listeners get a free trial of Premium Membership.

STORYBLOCKS
Video is one of my most effective ways to stand out as a creator online these days - and with Storyblocks you can take your videos to the next level - with Affordable Subscriptions, Unlimited Downloads, and 1M+ Royalty Free Assets - you can level up your content at  storyblocks.com/CreativePepTalk
author: andy@andy-j-miller.com (Co-Loop Podcast Network)

itunes:title: 362 - Why You End Up Right Where You Started and 3 Ways to Breakthrough
itunes:author: Co-Loop Podcast Network
itunes:summary:
Is there an area of your creative practice that you just can not seem to make progress in? Do you second guess every new piece and project to the point of doing nothing at all?
 
In this episode we explore the two competing forces within you that are pulling your creativity apart, and how to get them working together on the same team.
 
In this episode:
- Why the definition of creativity is surprising
- What it means to be a career creative
- An activity for determining what work you should focus on
